limebrokerage.trading.api

Class AckOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • limebrokerage.trading.api.AckOptions

  • public final class AckOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    Optional additional order information provided on new order and cancel-replace acks.
    See Also:
    Callback.onOrderAck(long, long, long, limebrokerage.trading.api.AckOptions), Callback.onReplaceAck(long, long, long, long, limebrokerage.trading.api.AckOptions)

    • Method Detail

      • hasConfirmPrice

        public boolean hasConfirmPrice()
        Check if the confirm price option is present. confirmPrice returns an undefined value unless this method returns true.
        Returns:
        true if the confirm price option is present
        See Also:
        confirmPrice

      • confirmPrice

        public long confirmPrice()
        Confirm price option. Set if the market has re-priced the order to a different value than specified being acking it. Use hasConfirmPrice to check if this option is present (this method returns an undefined value if it is not set).
        Returns:
        price the order was re-priced to (scaled by Client.PRICE_SCALE)
        See Also:
        hasConfirmPrice

      • hasDisplayPrice

        public boolean hasDisplayPrice()
        Check if the display price option is present. displayPrice returns an undefined value unless this method returns true.
        Returns:
        true if the display price option is present
        See Also:
        displayPrice

      • displayPrice

        public long displayPrice()
        Display price option. Set if the market has displayed the order at a different price than specified. Use hasDisplayPrice to check if this option is present (this method returns an undefined value if it is not set).
        Returns:
        price the market displayed the order at (scaled by Client.PRICE_SCALE)
        See Also:
        hasDisplayPrice

      • displayPriceAdjusted

        public boolean displayPriceAdjusted()
        Display price adjusted option. True if the market has displayed the order at a different price than specified. This option is used instead of display price for the markets which merely inform us the display price was adjusted, but don't actually tell us what price it was adjusted to.
        Returns:
        true if the display price option option is present

      • marketClientOrderId

        public java.lang.String marketClientOrderId()
        Market client order-id option. If present, contains the identifier used by the trading-server to identify the order to the market. This is not the same as the order-id specified in the place call, nor will it necessarily be the same as the Lime order-id in the onOrderAck callback.
        Returns:
        order-id used by the trading-server to identify the order to the market (null if option not present)

      • marketOrderId

        public java.lang.String marketOrderId()
        Market order-id option. If present, contains the identifier used by the market to identify the order.
        Returns:
        order-id used by the market to identify the order (null if option not present)

      • hasPositionEffect

        public boolean hasPositionEffect()
        Check if the position effect option is present. position effect returns an undefined value unless this method returns true.
        Returns:
        true if the position effect option is present
        See Also:
        positionEffect

      • positionEffect

        public PositionEffect positionEffect()
        Position effect option. The value of position effect as sent to market, this may be changed by the trading server. Use hasPositionEffect to check if this option is present (this method returns an undefined value if it is not set).
        Returns:
        position effect of the corresponding order
        See Also:
        hasPositionEffect

      • hasSide

        public boolean hasSide()
        Check if the side option is present. side returns an undefined value unless this method returns true.
        Returns:
        true if the side option is present
        See Also:
        side

      • side

        public Side side()
        Side option. The value of side as sent to market, this may be changed by the trading server. Use hasSide to check if this option is present (this method returns an undefined value if it is not set).
        Returns:
        side of the corresponding order
        See Also:
        hasSide

Securities are offered by Lime Trading Corp., member FINRA & SIPC,NFA. All investing incurs risk, including but not limited to loss of principal. Further information may be found on our Disclosures Page.

Please read the following documents Characteristics and Risks of Standardized Options before trading options. Options involve risk and are not suitable for all investors as the special risks inherent to options trading may expose investors to potentially rapid and substantial losses. Options trading privileges are subject to Lime Trading Corp. review and approval. Hedging and protective strategies generally involve additional costs and do not assure a profit or guarantee against loss. With long options, investors may lose 100% of funds invested. Covered calls provide income, downside protection only to the extent of the premium received, and limit upside potential to the strike price plus premium received. Multi-leg option orders are not a standard option trade. There is no national best bid or offer for multi-leg orders. Multi-leg trades are executed on the exchanges at the discretion of specialists or market makers, who cannot be held to a net price on a multi-leg order. Therefore, you may not receive the national best bid or offer on each individual leg of an order. Multi-leg orders are executed as a single trade on the same exchange. Legs cannot be executed separately on different exchanges to get the national best bid or offer for each leg. Each individual leg of a multi-leg order can be subject to early exercise risk, possibly taking away the protection that the multi-leg position may provide. Partial or full assignment on a leg may originate a margin call or losses greater than you anticipated when you entered into the position. When a multi-leg order is canceled or filled, additional reporting may be required by the specialist or market maker. Reporting fills and cancels may cause delays and create risks, especially in fast moving markets. Other risks might be associated with multi-leg options trading.
